title: List Creation and Basic Operations
code:
fruits = ['apple', 'banana', 'cherry']  # create list
fruits.append('plum')  # add an item
print(fruits[1])  # banana
fruits.remove('apple')  # remove an item
fruits.sort(reverse=True)  # sort in descending order (in-place)
explanation: Creates a list, appends an item, accesses an element by index, removes an item, and sorts the list in descending order. Note that the sort() method modifies the list in place and returns None.
